item.title: Virtual Career Fair - Analytics and Decision Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

We would like to connect with candidates pursuing Analytics and Decision Science job opportunities in areas such as:

  • Data and Reporting
  • Decision Science
  • Frontline and Distribution Analytics
  • Optimization
  • Product Analytics
  • Risk Analytics

Career Exploration Event

We’re hosting a virtual career exploration event where you’ll connect with team members, leaders and hiring managers in Analytics and Decision Science who are eager to share their stories with you. At this exclusive event, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Learn more about career opportunities
  • Learn about our purpose, culture, and commitment to community
  • Ask our team members questions

Event Details:

  • Date: Wednesday April 13th
  • Presentation and Panel Discussion: 4:30pm-5:30pm EST
  • Q&A : 5:30pm-6:00pm EST
  • Location: Microsoft Teams (access information to follow)
  • By Invitation Only

To register for this event:

  • Click Apply
  • Enter your first name, last name and contact information
  • Upload your resume or input your LinkedIn profile URL
  • Once you have applied, a Talent Acquisition Partner will connect with you to discuss next steps
  • The Wednesday April 13th VCF is an invitation-only event

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 10th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr Manager, Data Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) is responsible for the identification, measurement and monitoring of all operational risks throughout the bank. Within GORM, the Advanced Analytics team provides data science expertise and best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms, responsible for data management, analysis, delivery and insight creation. The Senior Manager, Data Science primary responsibilities include working with the Advanced Analytics team and the GORM partners to analyze and model operational risk data to identify insights in order to mitigate risks.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you’ll succeed

  • Model Development Skills – Developing advanced models to extract insights from large volumes of structured and unstructured data using programming languages such as Python.

  • Manage Production Models – Drive actions and reduce risk by managing statistical and machine learning models, which include monitoring model performance.

  • Database Skills – Accessing massive datasets by using advanced SQL/relational database knowledge.  Experience designing databases, tables, views, complex queries and stored procedures.

  • Data Visualization Skills -  Translating data to insights by authoring strategic dashboards intended for the broader GORM team, senior leaders and executives. Requires skills using Tableau or similar interactive data visualization business intelligence applications.

  • Curious and Creative – Innovative and likes to try new concepts and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive

  • Planning and Coordination - Effectively interact with all stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements, prepare design specifications, and provide technical support for applications, as instructed by senior team members.

  • Stay Current with Best Practices – Constantly looking for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, staying up to date with industry best practices in data management tools and big data analytics

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning, time-series analysis and predictive modeling. Good understanding of business environment (preferably financial industry) and the ability to apply machine learning techniques to solve business challenges.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, and/or a related field of study or relevant work/project experience

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Senior Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Client Analytics and Forecasting team has the objective to provide senior management with the necessary information for the retail lending portfolios so they have a good understanding of the risk profile of the existing portfolios which is critical to ensuring the sustainable performance that CIBC’s risk appetite demands.

As a Senior Consultant Client Analytics and Forecasting, you will be developing advanced statistical models that evaluate credit risk and stress testing across a variety of retail credit portfolios including credit cards, personal loans and lines of credit, residential mortgages and small business loans. You will also contribute to the profitable growth of personal lending portfolios by independently and proactively performing the activities that support the performance monitoring, portfolio loss forecasting and analytics for the credit cards, residential mortgages, secured and unsecured lines/loans portfolios including student loans. Also, the successful candidate will write technical model documentation to support the model vetting and validation process. You will also improve forecasting processes and methodologies, identify weaknesses and close the gap of inefficiencies, explore new data sources, and develop deeper understanding of clients.

Proactively identify opportunities within the personal lending portfolio operations where analytical techniques can be effectively applied to achieve core business objectives. Consulting with business partners, assessing each unit’s needs and developing an analytical plan to demonstrate the range of options and potential impacts.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in Economics, Finance or other applicable discipline.
  • You have a graduate degree in areas with exposure to statistical or machine learning coursework (Statistics, Math, Data Analytics, Economics, Finance, Data Science).
  • You can demonstrate experience in working with SAS (Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner) or similar analytical tools (i.e. SQL, Python, R), Tableau, VBA, Excel macros, Hyperion Essbase planning systems and databases.
  • You can develop and execute statistical/machine learning models for all retail risk systems. Understand and generate critical actionable insights from data.
  • You have good understanding of stress testing models, credit cards, residential mortgages, secured/unsecured lines and loans business.
  • You are familiar with best practices in forecasting methodologies and innovative analytical tools, and can leverage this knowledge to enhance NCL management strategies.
  • You are proficient in Financial Analysis and develop and maintain models to forecast retail lending NCL. Complete trend, performance and variance analysis; reviewing financial information to ensure risks are identified and underlying causes of variances are understood. Provide financial impacts of various scenarios and “what if” situations; develop specialized reporting and performs ad-hoc analysis.
  • You will ensure the timely, accurate and informative delivery of “forward looking” information to assist in senior leader decision support. This includes preparation of the NCL Annual Financial Plan, Quarterly Financial Forecasts and Latest Estimates. In addition, this position provides guidance on planning and forecasting NCL for the retail lending portfolio while acting as the central consolidator of this information. This role also involved in the ongoing analysis and interpretation of NCL to ensure relevant issues are highlighted to senior management.
  • You will prepare and communicate insightful analysis including, variance analyses and prior period performance.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You are skillful in evaluating complex data relationships and developing fact based reports and presentations on the knowledge gained from the analysis; being able to generate insights and recommend solutions to problems and present the outcomes.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

How You’ll Succeed

  • You exhibit CIBC’s values of trust, team work, and accountability
  • You will frequently liaise with other departments to establish collaborative relationships, provide expertise, and communicate forecasting estimates.
  • You will be responsible for data-driven forecasts that enhance efficiency and predictability.
  • You are keen in problem solving
  • You process good writing and visual presentation skills sufficient to articulate the results of analysis performed
  • You have well-developed communication skills to facilitate development of good working relationships within CIBC
  • You are able to execute job functions with minimal supervision

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan 

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 10th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Microsoft Excel Macros, SAS Enterprise, SAS Enterprise Miner, SAS SQL, Stress Testing, Structured Query Language (SQL), VBA Macro

item.title: Manager, Secured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

The Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, Alteryx, Tableau).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Consultant , BI Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Consultant, BI  Analytics reporting to the Director, BI and Strategy, Analytics and Decision Science and will be accountable for the day-to-day and strategic opportunities that align with the Personal and Business Banking Strategy. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead the delivery of data driven insights and solutions to evaluate client behaviors and to optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas.   

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Business Effectiveness - Identify and recommend changes that enhance operations whether through technology or other processes to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.
  • Strategic Thinking Approach – Drive, manage and execute PBB data and reporting projects and initiatives in alignment with CIBC and PBB Strategy while supporting the business goals, objectives and KPIs. Ability to think strategically about how to mobilize and engage teams across the enterprise to deliver strategic change.
  • Relationship Management - Manage the relationship between the Data and Reporting and various partners throughout the bank with a high focus on client experience and partnering for shared success.  Build internal and external relationships as required to help ensure we are providing the right level of service to our leadership team and business partners. 
  • Communication -  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.
  • Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. Support in the tracking and communication of performance metrics.
  • Design & Develop: Act as a SME on the analysis of requirements. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative data and reporting solutions to meet business objectives.

Who You Are  

  • You can demonstrate experience in:  Various BI reporting solutions Cognos reports including Cognos Cubes , Tableau , Thoughtspot . ETL development like Alteryx , SAS . Database experience : Oracle , Netezza , Azure SQL . Microsoft Azure is an asset. Microsoft Azure Data Platforms :  Databricks , Synapse and BI tools on Azure
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You use your relationships and technical knowledge to influence enterprise projects.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto 750 Law Ave. W., W5

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Risk Analytics Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) is responsible for the identification, measurement and monitoring of all operational risks throughout the bank. Within GORM the Advanced Analytics team provides data science expertise and best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms, responsible for data management, analysis, delivery and insight creation.  The Risk Analyst’s primary responsibilities include working with the Advanced Analytics team and the GORM partners to analyze and visualize operational risk data to identify insights in order to mitigate risks.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Visualization Skills – Translating data to insights by authoring strategic dashboards intended for the broader GORM team, senior leaders and executives. Requires skills using Tableau or similar interactive data visualization business intelligence applications.

  • Database Skills – Accessing massive datasets by using advanced SQL/relational database knowledge.  Experience designing databases, tables, views, complex queries and stored procedures.

  • Programing Skills – You have hands-on programming experience using Python.

  • Data Management – Supporting the ongoing day-to-day data ETL operations. Proactively participate in the analysis and resolution of problems adversely affecting the efficiency or integrity of the data

  • Data Modelling Skills – Assisting in the sourcing and building of ETL pipelines for new data sources for analytical/data visualization projects in GORM and its business partners 

  • Curious and Creative – Innovative and likes to try new concepts and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive

  • Planning and Coordination - Effectively interact with all stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements, prepare design specifications, and provide technical support for applications, as instructed by senior team members.

  • Stay Current with Best Practices – Constantly looking for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, staying up to date with industry best practices in data management tools and big data analytics

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: supporting the end-to-end process for creating and managing visualization pipeline (e.g., sourcing data, database organization and structuring, creating ETL pipelines, and designing dashboards).

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, and/or a related field of study or relevant work/project experience

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Senior Manager, Fraud Analytics, Enterprise Fraud Management
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing 

As the Senior Manager, Fraud Analytics, you will be leading and supervising the work of a group of analysts with a focus on fraud mitigation, computer programming, statistical models, and reporting associated with the development and implementation of fraud mitigation strategies. You will assist the team in the development and application of complex analysis, cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models and sampling.  You will maintain tight control over impact to legitimate customers from fraud management strategies and handle regular reporting of statistics to SVP and EVP levels of results in this area. Accountable for the development of transaction monitoring requirements and project implementation. Responsible for maintaining tight control over data and access management, and audit requirements.

  • You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

 

How You’ll Succeed 

  • Analytical Thinking – Lead a Data Analytics team to improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.  

  • Communication Skills – Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment. 

  • Leadership Skills - Provide leadership and effective management of business unit staff to influence employee commitment to the organization  

  • Continuous Improvement - Lead efforts in continuous improvement by implementing automation and business intelligence strategies 

 

Who You Are 

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. 

  • You have experience in analytical techniques and constantly seek to improve your knowledge in this field. You have strong ability using SAS, Tableau and/or SQL.  

  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline. 

  • You love to learn. You are passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.  

  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what is possible.  

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values – trust, teamwork, and accountability. 

What CIBC offers
 

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

 

 

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Sr. Consultant - Business System Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you\'ll be doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Technology Team. You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Sr. Business Systems Consultant (BSC), you’ll support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology. You’ll ideate and collaborate with a diverse team to create and set up flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best-in-class client experience.

How you\'ll succeed

  • Understanding and documenting requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complicated business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Create strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.

  • Solution design - Assemble client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate solution design documents around areas such as scope clarification, solution requirements, and quality assurance.

  • Leading and mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who you are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.

  • You\'re inspired by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.

  • Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a BSC role leading projects and designing solutions. It’s an asset if you have experience with Agile methodologies, and Application and/or Architecture Development.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Consultant, Real Estate Secured Lending
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Provide analytics to support the development of proposals/business cases for credit policy, process, system adjudication rules and account management strategy that will improve real estate secured lending credit risk management performance (e.g. increase system approval rates within acceptable risk boundaries). As the Consultant, Real Estate Secured Lending, Retail Risk Management, you will undertake analytics in support of driving deeper insights into the performance of various segments of the real estate secured portfolios. Work with Risk Managers to design ad-hoc reports and queries, and identify potential risks or opportunities.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Experience – You have knowledge of credit risk management policies, standards and guidelines to enable the completion of various analytical assignments. Experience in real estate secured lending is an asset. You are familiar with Credit Bureau data and its uses in risk strategies or scoring.
  • Analytical – You possess strong analytical and creative problem solving skills with the ability to interpret and analyze information to formulate sound conclusions.
  • Communication – You have the ability to convey technical information in understandable terms, both written and verbal. Effectively prepare and present data and insights to senior executives.
  • Adaptable - You are a proactive self-starter and have flexibility to adapt to an evolving environment with shifting priorities

Who You Are

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • You\'re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You can demonstrate experience in – You have experience with data analysis tools and databases (eg. SAS EG, SQL, TRIAD, Decision Manager).
  • You have a degree/diploma in – You have a university degree in Business, Finance, MBA degree or equivalent.  Accounting or Analyst (FRM, CFA) designations, or studies in quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Applied Science/Math or related field is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Regular

37.5

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Management & Research
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you\'ll be doing

As a member of the Asset Management team and under the direction of the Director, Data Management & Research, you are lead the Data Management & Research team (formerly known as Investment Data Management team) to perform their tasks efficiently and in a timely manner as well as serving as the main point of contact on any data related platforms in scope of the team in regards to data issues/requests. As the Senior Manager, Data Management & Research , you make sure to keep a teamwork, trust and accountability focus environment within the team. You are leading the creation and enhancement of Data Management protocols (including data governance, data quality, data integration, data security etc.) for all data sources and processes required by the various teams at CAM with a focus on the investment teams. As Senior Manager, you also collaborate with other business partners on the development and evolution of the data model used by the current Business Intelligent solution.

You are flexible to work our support coverage hours which may include evenings and/or weekends to deliver a high service level to our data consumers.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1 or 2 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you\'ll succeed

  • Team Management - Lead the team to perform all the required tasks in their relevant application accurately, efficiently and in a timely manner while ensuring the execution quality of those daily, monthly, quarterly tasks and have an extensive understanding of their purpose and mechanic.
  • Data Management - Build and enhance Data Management processes which covers data governance, data quality, data integration, data security principles that are strategic to deliver reliable data to our multiple data consumers.
  • Leveraging Technology - Be the expert on our Business Intelligence ecosystem. Share your knowledge by introducing business partners to our BI solution, enabling them to get data/information faster and better.
  • Relationship building - Engage relationship with key vendors such as RIMES, BNY Mellon, S&P, FTSE etc. Collaborate with key business partners such as Client Portfolio Managers, Quantitative Research team, Product Development team and many others.

Who you are

  • You have a degree/diploma in Finance, Math, business area of concentration, Data Science, Technology or an equivalent combination of education, training, experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required.  A Master’s degree in Finance, Math, business area of concentration, Data Science or Technology is an asset.
  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 10 years experience working experience of financial services industry experience in a data analysis capacity.
  • You can demonstrate experience in domain-specific languages such as SQL, Business Intelligence & Analytics software such as Alteryx and/or QlikSense as well in data management principles and data modelling.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.
  • You embrace and advocate for change. You continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You\'re fluent in French and English.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Consultant, Quantitative Risk Modelling
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Credit Risk Modelling has several duties including with respect to Retail Risk models and scorecards including model development, assessment and consultation. Credit Risk Rating Models must be developed and deployed in a timely and efficient manner and they must compliment business strategies. Reporting to the Director, Credit Risk Modeling, this position pro-actively contributes to the portfolio management function in the area of model building, model performance monitoring and other analysis.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Develop Statistical Models - the Senior Quantitative Analyst will be responsible for developing statistical models targeted to address Retail Risk Management and work in the performance monitoring of scorecards and models used in retail risk portfolios.
  • Utilize Statistical Tools -  such as SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Enterprise Miner and associated specialized modules to conduct and verify credit risk rating  model calculations for a variety of retail portfolios, including credit cards, personal loans and lines of credit, residential mortgages, small business credit facilities, anti-money laundering, fraud, collections, and others. 
  • Communication - this position will act as a main point of contact for communicating effectively to Risk Business Managers and other risk regulatory requirements, questions and concerns related to all models and scorecards.

Who You Are

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • Detail Oriented. You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Agile/Adaptable. You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Analytical. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have an advanced degree (M.Sc. or Ph.D.) in a quantitative (statistics/mathematics/applied sciences) field. Expert knowledge of SAS and its statistical procedures and techniques.  Other knowledge of mathematical or statistical application tools used for analytics an asset.
  • You can demonstrate experience with analytical and statistical procedures and techniques. You are to conceptualize, research, compile and translate analytical findings into meaningful strategies or recommendations. You possess excellent presentation skills to communicate very technical, analytical or conceptual information and ideas effectively to business users; both written and verbal. Expertise in working with complex data to extract, merge, clean based on the knowledge gained though analysis of the data and working with business SME. Ability and willing to work effectively multiple projects of varying complexity. Ability to prioritize and highly committed to meeting deadlines

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto 750 Law Ave. W., W6

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Analytical Skills (Inactive), Artificial Intelligence (Inactive), Business Analysis, Creativity, Credit Risk Modeling, Credit Risks, Data Analytics (Inactive), Demonstrating Inquisitiveness (Inactive), Forecasting (Inactive), Model Risk, Problem Solving, Research (Inactive), Researching, Risk Management, SAS Enterprise, SAS Enterprise Miner, Statistical Applications, Statistical Models

item.title: Consultant, Business Intelligence Development
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to Senior Manager, BI Development, you will be responsible for development of Contact Centres’ Insights and Analytics solutions, working closely with Business Analysts as well as Technology and Business Partners in a fast-paced Agile environment.   

You will be working with structured and semi-structured data, building relational and multi-dimensional Data Models, Analytics and Reporting Solutions to enable data-driven decision making for partners across CIBC Contact Centres LOBs.  

  • You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Deliver Timely and Accurate Solutions – Design, develop and deliver data models and reporting satisfying user requirements. Ensure data presentation is accurate, intuitive, timely and visually appropriate for broad spectrum of stakeholders audience comprehension. Ensure ease of maintenance and proper access controls.

  • Technology – leverage data and analytical tools to analyze structured and unstructured datasets, build data models, reporting and visualization solutions from multiple data sources.   

  • Establish & Maintain Business Relationships – Develop strong relationships with peers, Business and Technology Partners through meetings, presentations and consulting.

  • Communication – Flexible in communicating at different technical levels for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in utilizing Business Intelligence & Visualization software applications for 4-5 years to develop data models and reporting (Tableau/Cognos or similar). You can give meaning to data and enjoy making sense of information. You are able to consult business partners to formulate their BI requirements. You have  3-5 years’ experience with RDBMS and  data warehouse and strong SQL skills. It’s an asset if you are familiar with Agile work environment. 

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering or equivalent practical work experience in a related field.

item.title: Sr. Financial Consultant
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing
The role supports Capital Markets CFO through financial, management and client reporting, forecasting, planning and analysis to support strategic decision making.  The lines of businesses served are diverse and complex in scope, with a requirement for a specialized and extensive adaptation of existing applications / systems. The position is responsible working with stakeholders to develop sales and financial plans, do performance measurement and identify areas of opportunities , but with the ability to effectively adapt processes / tasks to accommodate changing priorities and meet business requirements.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

 

How You’ll Succeed

•   Data Analysis - Ability to comprehend and summarize large data sets, interpret and present data in a manner to drive decision making
•   Analytical - Prepare and forecast P&L, Resources (including Balance sheet), FTE, and other financial and non-financial performance measures.  Assist in the planning process which includes P&L, balance sheet, resources, by Line of Business. Provide financial analysis, ensure org units are set up, assist in plan transfers and ensure that the financial data will be appropriately captured. Enhance existing processes for reporting and monitoring   
•    Collaborative - Prepare financial presentations for various business partners on a wide variety of topics. Respond to ad hoc business requests and be the backup for team members when they are away. 

 

Who You Are?

•    Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
•    You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
•    You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
•    You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
•    You’re a certified professional with a bachelors degree in computer science or finance. You have current accreditation and good standing as a MBA or CPA, CA and /or CFA with a bachelor’s degree. 
•    You can demonstrate experience with Advanced Excel & PowerPoint, SQL, Java and Python and/or other client reporting tools. Knowledge and understanding of accounting/reporting systems (e.g., trial balances, journal entry, income statement, balance sheet) is an asset.

•   4-6 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence .

 

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

·       We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

·       Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

·       We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Sr. UX Strategist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll work on the Frontline Technology Strategy User Experience (UX) team which is responsible for conceptualizing and designing UX for employee-facing software applications. You’ll partner with other units across the bank to shape and communicate user experience strategies and design, often serving as the team advisor responsible for defining the overall UX vision throughout the digital ecosystem. You’ll apply an user-centred design approach by using various Research methods while integrating Design Thinking, Strategic Foresight and Analytics in order to fulfill the needs of the Business.  You’ll present recommendations to stakeholders and executives based on data, user feedback and insights collected to support with strategic decision making that support a long-term vision.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • UX Strategy – You’ll work with stakeholders and other members of the Frontline UX Team to give valuable input and recommendations to key business decisions with an user-centered mindset. You’ll help define an UX Vision and an UX Roadmap for our direct organization using Strategic Foresight. You’ll leverage core themes and findings from UX Research activities and communicate it to the Business for impactful and meaningful short, medium and long-term strategic decisions, while supporting with prioritizing activities and working closely to the Innovation team.
  • Data Analysis – You’ll give meaning to data by connecting design strategy and business metrics. You will look deeply into human behavioral data e how it shifts among time to propose unique but adoptable solutions and approaches to form a robust UX strategy roadmap.
  • Collaborate - You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team to develop experiences for our clients and employees. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders to help them set a vision for projects, including framing the problems to be solved and defining criteria for project success. You’ll work effectively within constraints, understanding the broader organizational context but also being ready to challenge it when necessary.
  • Research and Present – You’ll promote UX research studies, develop Personas, facilitate discovery sessions, run design thinking workshops, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data. You’ll analyze and translate research data into meaningful insights and powerful stories using artifacts such as customer journey maps, videos and storyboards, executive memos, compelling reports, and townhall presentations that explain unmet needs and present opportunities for change in the future-facing and nearer-term experiences.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centred and client-centred designs to project peers in a collaborative way that supports Business Strategy. Establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with stakeholders, Tech partners, vendors and peers to drive research-led design process.
  • Leadership -  Articulate business value of UX Strategy to stakeholders.

Who You Are

  • You have a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on UX related experience. Team or project Lead experience is an asset.
  • You have a degree/diploma in design and research such as Behavioural Science, Inclusive Design, Data Science, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You are curious and can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.
